modelIdentification.name: NETN-CBRN
modelIdentification.purpose: The NATO Education and Training Network Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear (NETN-CBRN) provides a standard interface for representing CBRN release, detection, effects, and protective measures in a federated distributed simulation. E.g., the exposure effect on individual humans in a CBRN-contaminated Hazard area where the human is represented in one simulation and the effect is modelled in another federate simulation.
modelIdentification.description:
CBRN are Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear materials that can be delivered intentionally as a weapon using conventional bombs, explosive materials and enhanced blast weapons (e.g., dirty bombs) or unintentionally caused by human error or natural or technological reasons, such as spills, accidental releases or leakages.
The NETN-CBRN module specifies how to model CBRN-related events in a federated distributed simulation.
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.1 - Initial version developed by MSG-106. Included in NETN FOM v2.0 and AMSP-04 Ed A.
v1.2 - Minor update of the NETN-CBRN FOM Module developed by MSG-163 and included in AMSP-04 Ed B.
v2.0 - Updated version developed by MSG-191. Release included in NETN FOM v4.0

poc.pocName: MSG-106 Enhanced CAX Architecture, Desing and Methodology
MSG-134 NATO Distributed Simulation Architecture & Design, Compliance Testing and Certification
MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation
MSG-191 NATO Standards for Federated Simulation and Services for Integration, Verification and Certification

attribute.name: Exposures
attribute.semantics: Array of agents to which this entity has been exposed to. Defaults to an empty array.

attribute.name: Treatments
attribute.semantics: The types of treatment that this entity has used. Defaults to an empty array.

attribute.name: TriageLevel
attribute.semantics: Triage level of this entity. Defaults to Uninjured.

attribute.name: IPEType
attribute.semantics: Type of IPE that the entity is using. Defaults to None.

objectClass.name: CBRN_Detector
objectClass.semantics: Represents a CBRN detector. This object is used to pass information to a CBRN federate, which will model the detector internally and publish a CBRN_DetectorAlarm.

attribute.name: ProcessingTime
attribute.semantics: Duration between the detector being exposed to a concentration of agent above its threshold and the detector raising an alarm.

attribute.name: AveragingTime
attribute.semantics: Duration the detector will collect samples.

attribute.name: DetectableAgents
attribute.semantics: Array of detectable agents and their thresholds.

attribute.name: Alarm
attribute.semantics: Data representing the alarm of this detector. Defaults to no alarm if the attribute is not set.

objectClass.name: CBRN_Sensor
objectClass.semantics: Represents a CBRN sensor. This object is used to pass information to a CBRN federate, which will return sensor readings by publishing CBRN_SensorUpdate interactions.

attribute.name: UpdateFrequency
attribute.semantics: Duration that this sensor would like between updated readings.

attribute.name: AveragingTime
attribute.semantics: Duration the sensor will collect samples.

attribute.name: DetectableAgents
attribute.semantics: Array of agents that this sensor wishes to detect.

attribute.name: SensorReadings
attribute.semantics: Latest sensor readings. Defaults to no readings if this attribute is not set.

objectClass.name: Platform
objectClass.semantics: A physical object under the control of armed forces upon which sensor, communication, or weapon systems may be mounted.

attribute.name: Contamination
attribute.semantics: CBRN hazardous agent inside vehicle due to embedded units.

objectClass.name: CulturalFeature
objectClass.semantics: Engineering and natural effects such as craters, bridges, vehicle tracks, etc.

attribute.name: Capacity
attribute.semantics: Required: The number of entities that this cultural feature can handle.

objectClass.name: COLPRO
objectClass.semantics: Represents a feature that provides Collective Protection (COLPRO) against a CBRN threat.

attribute.name: Protection
attribute.semantics: The effectiveness that this COLPRO offers for each agent.

objectClass.name: DecontaminationStation
objectClass.semantics: Represents a feature that provides treatment for CBRN exposure.

attribute.name: DecontaminationPeriod
attribute.semantics: Required: Duration it takes to decontaminate an entity.

attribute.name: Treatments
attribute.semantics: Required: The types of treatment that this decontamination station currently offers.

objectClass.name: CBRN_Hazard
objectClass.semantics: A generic representation of a CBRN Hazard.

attribute.name: AgentType
attribute.semantics: Requierd: Agent reflected in this contour.

attribute.name: Contours
attribute.semantics: Optional: Array of contours. These should be ordered in a sequence of ascending PercentProbabilityLevel.

attribute.name: ExposureType
attribute.semantics: Optional: The type of exposure.

attribute.name: HazardType
attribute.semantics: Type of hazard.

objectClass.name: CBRN_Hazard_Prediction
objectClass.semantics: Represents the footprint generated by a CBRN warning and reporting simulation. This follows the NATO ATP-45 doctrine to generate a hazard area.

attribute.name: Duration
attribute.semantics: Duration that this hazard prediction is valid.

attribute.name: ATP45HazardAreaType
attribute.semantics: This hazard area's type

attribute.name: AgentClass
attribute.semantics: The agent class

interactionClass.name: ApplyIPE
interactionClass.semantics: Represents an task for the specified entities to use individual protective equipment.

interactionClass.name: AdministerTreatment
interactionClass.semantics: Represents an order for the specified entities to receive the list of treatments.

interactionClass.name: SetPlatformContamination
interactionClass.semantics: Represents an update to the contaminating mass inside a vehicle due to embedded entities.

parameter.name: Contamination
parameter.semantics: New state of CBRN hazardous agent inside vehicle due to embedded units.

interactionClass.name: SetCasualtyEffect
interactionClass.semantics: Informs the federate representing the entity of the casualty effects of exposure.

parameter.name: TriageLevel
parameter.semantics: Required: Triage level of this entity.

parameter.name: Exposures
parameter.semantics: Optional: Array of agents to which this unit has been exposed.

interactionClass.name: CBRN_Release
interactionClass.semantics: Communicates information associated with the release of hazardous agent.

parameter.name: Agent
parameter.semantics: The type of released CBRN hazardous agent.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Initial location of the release in the geocentric location system.

parameter.name: Mass
parameter.semantics: Total released agent mass in kg.

parameter.name: ReleaseSize
parameter.semantics: The initial size of the release including initial Gaussian sigmas of the released puff and mean & variance of released particles.

parameter.name: ReleaseDynamics
parameter.semantics: Temperature differance and density ratio of released material relative to the atmosphere.

interactionClass.name: CBRN_SensorUpdate
interactionClass.semantics: Sends information about the current state of a previously registered CBRN sensor.

parameter.name: Concentration
parameter.semantics: Required: Mean Concentration in kg m-3.

interactionClass.name: CBRN_DetectorAlarm
interactionClass.semantics: Represents the alarm trigger of a previously registered CBRN detector.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required: Location of the detection (location of Detector)

simpleData.name: DensityRatioFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Ratio of density of two materials in range [0, 1].

simpleData.name: MeanMetersFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Mean of a Gaussian distribution, based on SI unit meter, unit symbol m.

simpleData.name: VarianceMetersSquaredFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Variance of a Gaussian distribution, based on SI unit meter squared, unit symbol m2.

enumeratedData.name: AgentClassEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Class of Agent for an ATP-45 Hazard Area.

enumeratedData.name: ATP45HazardAreaTypeEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of ATP-45 Hazard Area (simple or detailed).

enumeratedData.name: CBRNDamageEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Level of damage due to CBRN exposure.

enumeratedData.name: ExposureTypeEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of exposure represented in a contour group.

enumeratedData.name: HazardTypeEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of dispersion output represented in a contour group.

enumeratedData.name: EntityControlActionEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration of Entity Control Actions. The datatype is expected to be extended in specific modules defining additional actions.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfAgentConcentrationStruct
arrayData.semantics: Array of agents and their concentrations.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfAgentMassStruct
arrayData.semantics: Array of agents and their masses.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfCBRNExposureStruct
arrayData.semantics: Array of agents and their dosages.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfSigmas6
arrayData.semantics: Size of the initial Gaussian puff sigma values.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfContourStruct
arrayData.semantics: A set of contour boundaries defining concentration levels in ascending order.

fixedRecordData.name: AgentConcentrationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Concentration value associated with a specific agent.

field.name: MeanConcentration
field.semantics: Concentration in kg m-3.

field.name: Agent
field.semantics: Enumeration representation of the agent.

fixedRecordData.name: AgentMassStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Mass of contaminant inside a vehicle brought in by an embedded unit.

field.name: ContaminatedMass
field.semantics: Mass in kg of contaminant.

field.name: Agent
field.semantics: Enumeration representation of the agent.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Location of the detector alarm.

field.name: Agent
field.semantics: Agent that the detector believes to have triggered this alarm.

fixedRecordData.name: CBRNExposureStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Dosage exposure value associated with a specific agent.

field.name: Exposure
field.semantics: Dosage value (in kg.s.m-3) which has caused this casualty. Defaults to 0.0.

field.name: Agent
field.semantics: Enumeration representation of the agent.

field.name: Time
field.semantics: Simulation time of this sensor reading.

field.name: Reading
field.semantics: Agent and concentration value in this reading.

fixedRecordData.name: ProtectionEffectivenessStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Protection effectiveness associated with a specific agent.

field.name: Effectiveness
field.semantics: Percentage by which this protection reduces effects. 0-100%

field.name: Agent
field.semantics: Enumeration representation of the agent.

fixedRecordData.name: ReleaseDistributionStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Mean and variance of the distribution of the particles or droplets in a release.

field.name: Mean
field.semantics: Mean size of the released material in meters.

field.name: Variance
field.semantics: Variance of the distribution of released particulates/droplets.

fixedRecordData.name: ReleaseDynamicsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the dynamic properties of a release.

field.name: DensityRatio
field.semantics: Ratio of material density relative to the atmosphere.

field.name: TemperatureDifference
field.semantics: Difference in temperature between the released material and the atmosphere in Celsius.

fixedRecordData.name: ReleaseSizeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the properties of the initial size of a release.

field.name: SigmaArray
field.semantics: Initial Gaussian sigmas of the released puff.

field.name: ReleaseDistribution
field.semantics: Details regarding the size of the released particles/droplets for non-gaseous materials.

fixedRecordData.name: TreatmentStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the properties for a CBRN treatment.

field.name: Effectiveness
field.semantics: Percentage by which this treatment reduces effects. 0-100%

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: Duration in seconds for which this treatment will remain effective.

field.name: TreatmentWindow
field.semantics: The time window in seconds between exposure and treatment for which this treatment is effective.

field.name: TreatableAgents
field.semantics: Array of agents that can be treated using this treatment.

field.name: Boundary
field.semantics: Points of the contour.

field.name: ProbabilityLevel
field.semantics: Percentage of entities within this contour being affected to the define exposure level.

field.name: ConcentrationLevel
field.semantics: Concentration level of the contour.

field.name: IPEType
field.semantics: Type of IPE. Use none (0) for no/removal of IPE.

field.name: Entities
field.semantics: The entities who will receive the treatment.

field.name: Treatment
field.semantics: Type of treatment to be applied to the entities.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration the treatment is given.

variantRecordData.name: TaskDefinitionVariantRecord
variantRecordData.semantics: Variant record for task definition data.

variantRecordData.name: TaskProgressVariantRecord
variantRecordData.semantics: Variant record for task progress data.

note.label: netn-cbrn_overview
note.semantics:
## Overview
The NETN-CBRN FOM module covers: 1. CBRN Source release modelling 2. CBRN Detector modelling 3. CBRN Effects modelling 4. CBRN Protective measures modelling 5. Hazard area modelling
The NETN-METOC module can model weather conditions that may impact the dispersion of CBRN materials and cause dynamic change to hazard areas.
## Contamination
The NETN-CBRN module provides modelling of CBRN contamination related to individual simulated `Platform` entities and `CBRN_Hazard` regions.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR
HLAobjectRoot <|-- BaseEntity HLAobjectRoot <|-- DIM_HazardRegion HLAobjectRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) HLAobjectRoot : CreateTime(NETN-BASE) BaseEntity <|-- PhysicalEntity BaseEntity : EntityIdentifier(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : EntityType(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : Spatial(RPR-BASE) PhysicalEntity <|-- Platform Platform : Contamination DIM_HazardRegion <|-- CBRN_Hazard DIM_HazardRegion : Area(NETN-DIM) CBRN_Hazard : AgentType CBRN_Hazard : Contours CBRN_Hazard : ExposureType CBRN_Hazard : HazardType PhysicalEntity <|-- Lifeform Lifeform <|-- Human Human : Exposures
```
A `CBRN_Release` event triggers the start of a CBRN-related event and indicates parameters used to initiate the modelling of a `CBRN_Hazard`. As contamination spreads in the environment, the `CBRN_Hazard` objects are updated, simulated platforms located in CBRN-affected regions are contaminated, and lifeforms are exposed.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR HLAinteractionRoot <|-- SMC_EntityControl HLAinteractionRoot <|-- CBRN_Release HLAinteractionRoot : SendTime(NETN-BASE) HLAinteractionRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) SMC_EntityControl <|-- SetPlatformContamination SMC_EntityControl : Entity(NETN-SMC) SetPlatformContamination : Contamination SMC_EntityControl <|-- SetCasualtyEffect SetCasualtyEffect : Exposures CBRN_Release : Agent CBRN_Release : Duration CBRN_Release : Location CBRN_Release : Mass CBRN_Release : ReleaseDynamics CBRN_Release : ReleaseSize CBRN_Release : ReleaseVelocity ```
The platform contamination and lifeform exposure are usually simulated but can also be set explicitly using NETN-SMC entity control interactions. Use the `SetPlatformContamination` interaction to set the `Platform` contamination level. Use `SetCausaltyEffect` to set `Lifeform` exposure levels.
## Protection and Treatment Individual `Lifeform` objects are extended with attributes related to CBRN exposure and treatments. Facilities providing protection and treatment are modelled using `DecontamiationStation` or CollectiveProtection `COLPRO` objects.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR
HLAobjectRoot <|-- BaseEntity
HLAobjectRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) BaseEntity <|-- PhysicalEntity BaseEntity : EntityIdentifier(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : EntityType(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : Spatial(RPR-BASE) PhysicalEntity <|-- Lifeform Lifeform <|-- Human
PhysicalEntity <|-- CulturalFeature
Human : IPEType Human : Treatments Human : TriageLevel
CulturalFeature <|-- COLPRO CulturalFeature <|-- DecontaminationStation CulturalFeature : Capacity COLPRO : Protection DecontaminationStation : DecontaminationPeriod DecontaminationStation : Treatments
```
Two NETN-ETR `Task` subclasses related to protection and treatment are defined in the NETN-CBRN module. Use the `ApplyIPE` task to request a `Lifeform` to apply individual protection equipment. Use the `AdministerTreatment` task to request an entity to initiate the treatment of a set of entities.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR HLAinteractionRoot <|-- SMC_EntityControl HLAinteractionRoot : SendTime(NETN-BASE) HLAinteractionRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) SMC_EntityControl <|-- Task
SMC_EntityControl <|-- SetCasualtyEffect
SetCasualtyEffect : TriageLevel SMC_EntityControl : Entity(NETN-SMC) Task <|-- ApplyIPE Task <|-- AdministerTreatment Task : TaskId(NETN-ETR) ApplyIPE : TaskParameters AdministerTreatment : TaskParameters ```
## Detection and Alarm
The NETN-CBRN can represent CBRN sensors and detectors as `Sensor` objects in the federation. These objects define, e.g., the type of `DetectableAgents` and are used to share aspects of the individual equipment to a CBRN simulation that can generate corresponding sensor events.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR
HLAobjectRoot <|-- BaseEntity HLAobjectRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) BaseEntity <|-- PhysicalEntity BaseEntity : EntityIdentifier(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : EntityType(RPR-BASE) BaseEntity : Spatial(RPR-BASE) PhysicalEntity <|-- Sensor Sensor <|-- CBRN_Detector Sensor <|-- CBRN_Sensor CBRN_Detector : Alarm CBRN_Detector : AveragingTime CBRN_Detector : DetectableAgents CBRN_Detector : ProcessingTime CBRN_Sensor : AveragingTime CBRN_Sensor : DetectableAgents CBRN_Sensor : SensorReadings CBRN_Sensor : UpdateFrequency ```
A CBRN federate can generate a `CBRN_DetectorAlarm` event to indicate a detected agent at a specific location. A CBRN federate can also generate a `CBRN_SensorUpdate` event to indicate the concentration of a specific agent.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR HLAinteractionRoot <|-- ETR_SensorEvent HLAinteractionRoot : SendTime(NETN-BASE) HLAinteractionRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE)
ETR_SensorEvent <|-- CBRN_SensorUpdate ETR_SensorEvent <|-- CBRN_DetectorAlarm ETR_SensorEvent : ProducingEntity(NETN-ETR) CBRN_SensorUpdate : Agent CBRN_SensorUpdate : Concentration CBRN_DetectorAlarm : Agent CBRN_DetectorAlarm : Location ```
## Prediction
The NETN-CBRN module also supports the `CBRN_Hazard_Prediction` object class to predict CBRN hazard regions. A prediction model can publish instances of this object to indicate a potential CBRN hazard.
```mermaid classDiagram direction LR
HLAobjectRoot <|-- DIM_HazardRegion HLAobjectRoot : UniqueId(NETN-BASE) HLAobjectRoot : CreateTime(NETN-BASE)
DIM_HazardRegion <|-- CBRN_Hazard_Prediction DIM_HazardRegion : Area(NETN-DIM)
CBRN_Hazard_Prediction : ATP45HazardAreaType CBRN_Hazard_Prediction : AgentClass CBRN_Hazard_Prediction : Duration ```

note.label: netn-cbrn_changelog_1
note.semantics:
Version 1.1.9 is the initial public release of the NETN-CBRN FOM Module developed by MSG-106 & MSG-134. This version is included in NETN-FOM v2.0 and AMSP-04 Ed A. Several internal development releases were also made available to the team and a summary of the changes are provided below
* v1.0.0 - Initial; object, interaction classes and datatypes. * v1.0.1 - Added semantics. * v1.0.2 - Added missing QuantityUInt32 simple data type, fixed IPEEnum values. * v1.1.0 - Added new attributes to ATP45HazardArea, CBRN_Sensor and CBRN_Detector. Added parent interaction type to COLPROUpdate and DecontaminationStationUpdate. Re-used existing RPR and NETN simple data types. Renamed several data types and attribute names. * v1.1.1 - Added references to dependencies. * v1.1.2 - Added ValidityTime attribute to ATP45HazardArea. * v1.1.3 - Updated the description. * v1.1.4 - Added CBRN_PlatformUpdate interaction. * v1.1.5 - Updated semantics. * v1.1.6 - Standardised on Agent for agent name. Used correct naming convention for CBRN_FacilityUpdate. * v1.1.7 - Changed update conditions for certain attributes. Added UniqueID attributes to hazard contours. * v1.1.8 - Added TIC agents to AgentTypeEnum16. * v1.1.9 - Added POC information.

note.label: netn-cbrn_changelog_2
note.semantics:
Version 1.2 of the NETN-CBRN was updated by MSG-163 and included in NETN-FOM v3.0 and AMSP-04 Ed B.
* Changed modelIdentification securityClassification from unclassified to Not Classified * Changed modelIdentification other to include license information * Changed modelIdentification reference to only refer to directly dependent FOM Modules * Added modelIdentification useLimitation to reflect Scope of FOM Module as defined in NETN-CBRN#2 * Added modelIdentification glyph * Added datatype GeocentricPolygon * Updated modelIdentification purpose to reflect Purpose of FOM Module as defined in NETN-CBRN#2 * Updated modelIdentification description to reflect Introduction of FOM Module as defined in NETN-CBRN#2 * Changed object class CBRN_SubmersibleVehicle to CBRN_SubmersibleVessel * Introduction section restructured and clarified including description, purpose and useLimitation. * Source Release section restructured and clarified including a new sequence diagram * Semantics of CBRN_Release attributes updated * Removed SimpleDatatype ConcentrationKgPerMeterCubedFloat32 (move to NETN-BASE and renamed MassConcentrationFloat32) * Changed use of data type TimeSecInt64 to EpochTimeSecInt64 (renamed in NETN-BASE) * Changed use of datatype ArrayOfWorldLocationStruct3 to GeocentricPolygon (renamed in NETN-BASE)

note.label: netn-cbrn_changelog_0
note.semantics: * Remodelled based on HLA4 modelling * Based on NETN-DIM * Simplified Hazard representation * Updated documentation
